channel.title: Ramah: Good News Feed
channel.description: Positive news stories from around the world, filtered by sentiment analysis

item.title: Top Iran security official to travel to Oman, site of talks with US, likely with nuclear message
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — A top Iranian security official traveled Tuesday to Oman, the Mideast sultanate now mediating talks between Tehran and the United States over the Islamic Republic’ nuclear program aimed at halting a possible American strike.

item.title: Live: Aussie flag-bearers start Olympic medal quest in moguls
item.description: Australia's flag-bearers, Jakara Anthony and Matt Graham, start their 2026 Winter Olympics campaign tonight with moguls qualifying.

item.title: BP halts share buy-backs as annual profits slide
item.description: BP has halted share buy-backs after reporting weaker annual profits as it prepares to continue a plan to resuscitate its fortunes under a new chief executive.

item.title: Heat seekers: amazing thermal images from the Winter Olympics
item.description: While most photographers are striving to ‘freeze’ motion using traditional cameras at the Winter Olympics this month, a creative trio from the photo agency Getty Images are seeking something much more unexpected: heat.

item.title: Four decades after we wrote Yes Minister, politics is still reduced to the pleasure of power | Jonathan Lynn
item.description: When people praised Tony Jay and me for Yes Minister’s prescience, we accepted the compliments graciously.

item.title: New oil and gas exploration site the 'size of Singapore' approved in Queensland
item.description: The Crisafulli government has appointed three energy companies as tenderers for oil and gas exploration in the Taroom Trough.

item.title: Buddhist monks head to DC to finish a 'Walk for Peace' that captivated millions
item.description: WASHINGTON — A group of Buddhist monks is set to reach Washington, D.C., on foot Tuesday, capping a trek from Texas that has captivated the country.

item.title: Cambridge University wins rowing trademark case
item.description: The University of Cambridge has won its fight to stop a rowing company based in the city trademarking its name.

item.title: Moroccan lamb filo pie and rhubarb panna cotta: Thomasina Miers’ Sunday best recipes
item.description: There is little as pleasing to cook in the depths of the winter as a pot of enticingly fragrant, slow-braised meat.

item.title: At school, I was my brother's protector. But I needed more support
item.description: Michael Roberts remembers the day he was pulled out of a maths test to help his brother.

item.title: Outback artist finds fame in Japan thanks to tote bag and J-pop star
item.description: A chance brush with fame led to Jason McCarthur's art exploding in popularity in Japan after J-pop star Fujii Kaze was spotted with one of the outback artist's bags.

item.title: Japan has given Takaichi a landslide win - but can she bring back the economy?
item.description: Japan's prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, rolled the dice on a snap election - and it paid off.

item.title: Olympians say don't run or jump while celebrating as more medals break
item.description: At least four athletes at the Winter Olympics have broken their medals while celebrating.

item.description: The age of AI is here and it's going to be infinitely useful, or so they tell us.

item.title: Troubles-rooted play Sapling wins Women’s prize for playwriting
item.description: A work that explores what happens when trauma is left to fester, set in Troubles-era Belfast, has been named the winner of the Women’s prize for playwriting 2025.

item.title: Australians' super savings exposed as clouds gather over tech boom
item.description: Last week, US tech giant Microsoft released a list of jobs likely to be swept aside in the upcoming artificial intelligence storm along with a corresponding list of occupations deemed relatively resilient to the impending onslaught.

item.title: Jon Kudelka's take on Rudd v Gillard one of his best, says Insiders host
item.description: Jon Kudelka, who died on Sunday aged 53, has been remembered as a "cartoonist's cartoonist" able to "cut through complex political issues".

item.title: Arizona holds No. 1 spot for 9th week in AP Top 25; Houston rises to No. 3, Kentucky returns at 25th
item.description: Arizona remained firmly atop The Associated Press Top 25 men’s college basketball poll for a ninth consecutive week Monday, while Houston jumped back into the top 5 and Kentucky returned to the rankings for the first time since December.

item.title: Pubs don’t deserve special measures | Letters

item.title: Friends set for new UK streamer as HBO Max reveals launch plans

item.title: From Spielberg to Tarantino: the year’s big Super Bowl movie trailers

item.title: Georgina Hayden’s quick and easy recipe for creamy chicken and mustard fricassee | Quick and easy
item.description: This is a one-pan dinner at its finest: elegant and full of flavour, something that feels as if it has taken more effort and time than it actually has, and versatile in its finish – serve with creamy mash, fluffy rice, boiled potatoes; even hunks of fresh baguette would be wonderful for mopping up the creamy mustard sauce.

item.title: Children with special needs in England will keep current support, minister says
item.description: Children with special needs will not lose their places at special schools or current levels of assistance, an education minister has told parents anxious that the government would strip away their child’s support.
